intro: Veronica bartsiifolia, commonly known as the Armenian speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia and Turkey. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or purple flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, often in alpine environments. It is a perennial herb that produces small, clustered flowers, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
